010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter2D;
013import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
014import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
015
016/**
017 * This class implements a Kuwahara-type filter, similar to the filter suggested in 
018 * Tomita and Tsuji (1977). It structures the filter region into five overlapping, 
019 * square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x (r+1). 
020 * See algorithm 5.2 in Utics Vol. 3.
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2020/12/29
024 */
025public class KuwaharaFilter extends GenericFilter2D {
026        
027        public static class Parameters {
028                /** Radius of the filter (should be even) */
029                public int radius = 2;
030                /** Threshold on sigma to avoid banding in flat regions */
031                public double tsigma = 5.0;
032                
033                public Parameters() {
034                }
035                
036                public Parameters(int radius, double tsigma) {
037                        this.radius = radius;
038                        this.tsigma = tsigma;
039                }
040        }
041        
042        private final Parameters params;
043        private final int n;                    // fixed subregion size 
044        private final int dm;                   // = d-
045        private final int dp;                   // = d+
046
047
048        // constructor using default settings
049        public KuwaharaFilter() {
050                this(new Parameters());
051        }
052        
053        public KuwaharaFilter(Parameters params) {
054                this.params = params;
055                //initialize();
056                int r = params.radius;
057                this.n = (r + 1) * (r + 1);     // size of complete filter
058                this.dm = (r/2) - r;                    // d- = top/left center coordinate
059                this.dp = this.dm + r;                  // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
060        }
061        
062        public KuwaharaFilter(int r, double tsigma) {
063                this(new Parameters(r, tsigma));
064        }
065        
066//      private void initialize() {
067//              int r = params.radius;
068//              n = (r + 1) * (r + 1);  // size of complete filter
069//              dm = (r/2) - r;                 // d- = top/left center coordinate
070//              dp = dm + r;                    // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
071//      }
072                
073//      private static int checkRadius(int radius) {
074//              assert radius >= 1 : "filter radius must be >= 1";
075//              return radius;
076//      }
077        
078        // ------------------------------------------------------
079
080        // these are used in calculation by several methods:
081        private float Smin;             // min. variance
082        private float Amin;             
083        private float AminR;
084        private float AminG;
085        private float AminB;
086        
087        // This method is used for all scalar-values images.
088        @Override
089        protected float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
090                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
091                evalSubregionGray(ia, u, v);                                    // a centered subregion (not in original Kuwahara)
092                Smin = Smin - (float)params.tsigma * n;                 // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
093                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dm, v + dm);
094                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dm, v + dp);
095                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dp, v + dm);
096                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dp, v + dp);
097                return Amin;
098        } 
099        
100        // sets the member variables Smin, Amin
101        private void evalSubregionGray(ScalarAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
102                float S1 = 0; 
103                float S2 = 0;
104                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
105                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {
106                                float a = ia.getVal(u+i, v+j);
107                                S1 = S1 + a;
108                                S2 = S2 + a * a;
109                        }
110                }
111//              double s = (sum2 - sum1*sum1/nr)/nr;    // actual sigma^2
112                float s = S2 - S1 * S1 / n;     // s = n * sigma^2
113                if (s < Smin) {
114                        Smin = s;
115                        Amin = S1 / n; // mean
116                }
117        }
118        
119        // ------------------------------------------------------
120        
121        private final float[] rgb = {0,0,0};
122        
123        @Override
124        protected float[] filterVector(ImageAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
125                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
126                evalSubregion(ia, u, v);                                                // centered subregion - different to original Kuwahara!
127                Smin = Smin - (3 * (float)params.tsigma * n);   // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
128                evalSubregion(ia, u+dm, v+dm);  
129                evalSubregion(ia, u+dm, v+dp);  
130                evalSubregion(ia, u+dp, v+dm);  
131                evalSubregion(ia, u+dp, v+dp);  
132                rgb[0] = (int) Math.rint(AminR);
133                rgb[1] = (int) Math.rint(AminG);
134                rgb[2] = (int) Math.rint(AminB);
135                return rgb;
136        }
137        
138        private void evalSubregion(ImageAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
139                // evaluate the subregion centered at (u,v)
140                //final int[] cpix = {0,0,0};
141                int S1R = 0, S2R = 0;   // TODO: use float throughout?
142                int S1G = 0, S2G = 0;
143                int S1B = 0, S2B = 0;
144                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
145                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {                
146                                float[] cpix = ia.getPix(u + i, v + j);
147                                int red = (int) cpix[0];
148                                int grn = (int) cpix[1];
149                                int blu = (int) cpix[2];
150                                S1R = S1R + red;
151                                S1G = S1G + grn;
152                                S1B = S1B + blu;
153                                S2R = S2R + red * red;
154                                S2G = S2G + grn * grn;
155                                S2B = S2B + blu * blu;
156                        }
157                }
158                // calculate the variance for this subregion:
159                float nf = n;
160                float SR = S2R - S1R * S1R / nf;
161                float SG = S2G - S1G * S1G / nf;
162                float SB = S2B - S1B * S1B / nf;
163                // total variance (scaled by nr):
164                float Srgb = SR + SG + SB;
165                if (Srgb < Smin) { 
166                        Smin = Srgb;
167                        AminR = S1R / n;        
168                        AminG = S1G / n;
169                        AminB = S1B / n;
170                }
171        }
172}
